thread.section_title: Broward County High School Sports - Sun Sentinel
thread.title: Another rout cements playoff berth for Chaminade
thread.title_full: Another rout cements playoff berth for Chaminade - Sun Sentinel

author: sun-sentinel.com
title: Another rout cements playoff berth for Chaminade
text:
Chaminade-Madonna scored 42 points in the first quarter and by the clock's final tick added another 28 to beat visiting Somerset Academy Silver Palms 70-6 on Friday afternoon.
With the win, the Lions keep their spotless 5-0, 2-0 record, cementing them atop the District 8-3A standings.
"This was a big game for us because if we won, we're playing in the playoffs," Lions coach Jason Milgrom said. "We had a good week of practice and got off to a quick start. We preach being physical up front and today, we were physical. That's all we needed. It looked good out there."
Chaminade-Madonna will travel to Westminster Christian next week to play for the district title.
Ahead of Friday's game, sophomore running back Shaun Shivers received an offer from Syracuse. The Orange, who also extended offers to Lions defensive ends Chris Whittaker and Davaon Hawkins, join West Virginia, Cincinnati, FAU and Florida A&M in serious pursuit of the 5-foot-7, 165-pound sophomore.
